alert.note: Alert for Dewey; Major; Woodward (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 10 at 9:07AM CDT until July 13 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Oklahoma... North Canadian River near Woodward affecting Woodward, Major and Dewey Counties. For the North Canadian River...including Woodward, Woodward, Seiling, Watonga, El Reno, Yukon, Oklahoma City at NW 10th Street, Oklahoma City at Britton Road, Harrah, Shawnee, Wetumka...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...North Canadian River near Woodward. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Shallow flooding of lowlands occurs along the river from the northwestern through the central and southeastern sections of Woodward County. Cattle and other property should be moved to locations higher than nearby river banks to avoid being stranded for hours by high water in side channels. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 4.1 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 515 PM CDT.
